modules.description: This module provides associative map operations for string keys, including insertion, deletion, querying, merging, and filtering. It manipulates polymorphic maps with string keys and arbitrary value types, supporting transformations to and from lists and sequences. Use cases include configuration management, data aggregation, and processing pipelines requiring efficient key-based access and extremal binding searches.

Generates boot code and stubs for a virtual machine. It takes a target directory and lists of variable and function declarations to produce corresponding code files. This module is used to initialize VM components with generated boilerplate code.

Handles reading and writing of reactive input/output data in a structured format, including parsing variable names and types, reading input values, and writing output results. Works with input/output channels and data structures like `Data.vntl` and `Data.subst`. Used for interfacing with external systems that require formatted data exchange, such as simulation tools or interactive environments.

This module provides a lexical analyzer that converts character streams into token streams, handling keywords, identifiers, integers, floats, strings, and characters. It works with character and token streams, using a list of keywords to classify tokens and supporting nested comments. It is used to parse source code into structured tokens for compilers or interpreters.

This module defines a rich set of data types for representing values (`v`) and types (`t`), including primitives, arrays, structs, enums, and aliases. It provides operations for converting values to strings, updating and creating values through access paths, and handling type definitions with aliases. Concrete use cases include representing and manipulating typed data structures in a domain-specific language or configuration system.

This module exposes two string values: `str`, representing a version identifier, and `sha`, representing a Git SHA hash. It is used to embed build-time version and source control information into applications. Concrete use cases include displaying version strings in command-line tools or logging build metadata in distributed systems.

This module configures plotting output formats and display settings, including terminal type (e.g., Jpg, Pdf, X11), window size, grid visibility, and variable filtering. It supports dynamic plot generation and resource file handling for external configuration. Concrete use cases include generating script-driven plots in batch mode or interactively visualizing data with specific formatting requirements.

This module implements string list conversion, environment variable access, file reading, and list manipulation functions including set operations and deduplication. It provides custom process creation and execution utilities with optional I/O redirection, along with string formatting and parsing functions for floats and numerical types. The module supports command-line argument handling, configuration management via string maps, and directory listing operations with pattern matching.
